snippet: With Jeremy Lin not expected to play Wednesday, and Baron Davis’s knee requiring surgery that will keep him out a year, the veteran Mike Bibby will start at point guard for the Knicks.
abstract: New York Knicks will open Game 5 of playoff series against Miami Heat with veteran Mike Bibby at point guard; having lost guards Iman Shumpert and Baron Davis to injuries, and Jeremy Lin's return from knee surgery unlikely to come in time, the Knicks are running out of options. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: There was a time, not long ago, when all things seemed possible in the Knicks' world, when odds were defied, conventional thought was crushed and the unexpected became routine. If only they could recapture the feeling, perhaps the Knicks could summon a playoff miracle, beat the Miami Heat three more times and became the first N.B.A. team to come back from a 3-0 deficit.

headline.main: Knicks Are Running Out Of Guards and Time
